newsitem.title: FRANCE: French court throws out Saddam suit against weekly.
newsitem.headline: French court throws out Saddam suit against weekly.

text.p: A French court on Tuesday threw out a libel suit brought by Iraqi President Saddam Hussein against the left-wing weekly Le Nouvel Observateur on technical grounds.
Saddam had brought the suit on the grounds the the magazine had libelled and insulted him.
The court said it could not handle the case since Saddam should not have pressed libel charges but charges for insults against a foreign head of state, which is an offence in France.

Saddam's lawyers said he had been prevented from doing so since such a move would have to go through diplomatic channels. These have been severed since the 1991 Gulf War in which France participated on the allied side.
